title: Tahm is Extremely Balanced
body: I just  played on the pbe and he is an extremely balanced champion. He can peel for isi adc just as good as anyone in the game (braum status) and has great base damage with his ult passive while building full tank. The catch is that he has 0 mobility, literally none. Yeah he has his ult but as far as dashes move speed increases, etc. he has nothing. It is pretty hard to land his passive so basically i just focused on using my devour on their initiator so my team could counter initiate and he couldn't touch my adc. In my opinion his kit is extremely well designed with obvious strengths and weaknesses. Riot did a great job designing this champion.

replies.body: If you nom an enemy can you flash over a wall to really remove them from the fight? I assume you can.

No, ZenonTheStoic has said he cannot flash or teleport with a unit inside of him.

[Source in this thread](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/riot-official/FjGpB9h6-champion-reveal-tahm-kench-the-river-king?comment=00130002)
I honestly wish that he could on release and then they changed it shortly after, just so I could have a couple games where I swallow an enemy and tp to the ward I placed on fountain.

While it would be funny, it would be impossible even if he could use teleport with an enemy inside him. Teleport channel is 3.5s, and Tahm can hold an enemy for up to 3s (half of how long he can hold an ally).
He has bard syndrome. His kit looks overpowered on paper. but in reality is actually fairly balanced.
The only overpowered thing about him is you can bring instant ganks to your lane with pretty much no counter play since they can't really ward against it. Otherwise his kit is balanced.
{{champion:98}} {{champion:4}} {{champion:80}} ?????
Can those 3 bring someone with them and have an instant 4 man gank bot? their global ult is solo, tahm can bring someone with him.
Yeah, but Mantheon doesn't need to bring anyone with him. He brings the pain all by his lonesome.
and shen can force you and all your friends to stay and enjoy the party
Well Technically, Shen could ult a TF or a Pantheon and then boom. They don't even know whats coming.
sure but thats restricted to just them. Tahm can bring any champion in the game with him.

I guess they are justifying it by having it 'telegraphed' via the trail he follows.  plus its not global, so you cant go from bot to top or anything crazy...if tahm mysteriously leaves lane you should know something is up.

Hence Jungle Tahm will be the way to go. Roam near a lane, ult to a different lane, wait for the nearby later to join you and boom, nobody needs TP to get into the fight.

That and Tahm with a Cinderhulk is scary as hell from what I've seen.

Tahm can't clear well enough to jungle, is extremely susceptible to counter jungling, and his ganking is pretty bad as well.  He can stun or eat an opponent, sure.  After he lands 3 damaging spells on them.
non. vids show is has great clear. AA-AA-Q-W-spit and wipe. Plate is clean.
Dunno what vids you've been watching, but 4:30 for a full clear is really bad.

From what I've seen (don't actually have a PBE account), if you max his W, his clear is actually pretty good, and while his ganks aren't great, he can pull them off decently well, and his main focus is to scale into late game for his impressive semi-global gank/initiations and strong teamfighting. He is certainly susceptible to counterjungling, but so is any other tank jungler, and Tahm is at least capable of shrugging off a large amount of incoming damage and dishing it back out pretty well.
can't devour the red or blue buff
what's your point? The AoE clear is still just as strong against those camps you know.
You lose a huge amount of damage. % damage is lost.
that percent damage is capped vs monsters, and you still deal most of that amount to them with the AoE from spitting the small creep back out (which only takes the % health damage anyway).

TAHM'S ULT ISNT GLOBAL. His ult radius really isnt that big. Even in late game its still not that huge. Its also not instant and it leaves a huge warning to wherever tahm is ulting. Someone playing tahm attempted a 2 man gank on me while i was playing varus (a very immobile champ) by ulting behind me. I literally just walked back to turret and they did nothing to me.

^This. At rank 1, it's just about twice the size of Nocturne's, allowing him to get from... the fountain to first turret (near the base walls.) A well placed Bard Portal can do just the same along the Purple side River leading up towards the tribush.
Hopefully he won't require a team more coordinated than the KGB.

Most supports lack mobility, that doesn't really make him unique.

I don't know either way whether he's balanced, but I just wanted to point that out.

but he lacks hard cc as well as mobility. His hard cc is incredibly hard to land and you can only use one. If they get to 3 stacks you can either stun them or devour them but not both. Getting 3 stacks is hard as it is. So he has no mobility and very hard to land cc. Hes balanced
I thought the stun didn't remove the stacks, so you can stun them an then devour them?

No as of right now since ive played him you can either stun them when they get to three stacks or devour them. Using Q or W at 3 stacks consumes his passive basically to allow you to either stun or devour but not both.

that is wrong the stacks only get consumed if he consumes someone if he stuns someone the stacks stay on so he can get to them and they can be devoured because of his lack of mobility.  I've played him a couple times on the pbe.

As an extra point, if that's not the behaviour that you're seeing, then it's a bug.
[According Riot fizznchips](http://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/3autrp/champion_reveal_tahm_kench_the_river_king/csg8ig1):
> Nope! They're not consumed by the Q. They're only lost when they time out, or when Tahm Kench eats an enemy champ.

I lol'd at {{champion:412}}  having no mobility. He has way more mobility than Karma or Sona.
Also, {{champion:89}} should be in the middle ground, for she can grab an enemy for mobility.
Leona and Thresh are mobile - while Lulu is in the middle-ground along with Karma, Janna, Sona and Zilean (sorry, but MS boost are so much less powerful than dashes).

Are you smoking? Zilean is one of the most mobile champs around. Watch vid to see how it works:

>
>  The catch is that he has 0 mobility, literally none. Yeah he has his ult but as far as dashes move speed increases, etc. he has nothing.

Doesn't he get a move speed buff for eating an allied champion?

yeah he does but that is worthless in solo lanes, only if you are support. Also in team fights the move speed is defensive not offensive as you will be using it on your adc and you wont devour him and run at the enemy. So he does have a movespeed increase but it doesn't help him land any of his abilities but rather to carry your carry out of danger.

But I think you only get the movespeed if you're running TOWARDS enemies.

EDIT: From the wiki

> ALLIED CHAMPIONS: Tahm Kench gains bonus movement speed **while moving toward enemy champions**, and both him and his ally can end the effect early.

^This. While it's good to eat your ADC and get them out, it's also very useful to eat someone like Alistar or Malphite, get a speed boost from something and run towards them, then spit out the tank for the %health damage and let them follow up.

Or even better devour your ulting {{champion:50}} {{champion:85}} {{champion:9}} {{champion:25}} 
Laugh maniacally while you chase the fleeing fools down

Who ever says this champion is balanced hasn't put any sort of AP on him and nom'd an enemy. >> His W does 36% of max health base, going up by 4% per 100 AP. Even if you only have the tankier AP items like a Liandry's, Rylai's, and a RoA, you'll have nearly 300 AP, which is 48% of ANYONE's health. His W is like... disgustingly broken. It needs to not have a ratio or have its base DRASTICALLY reduced. Nom'ing some one for 2s is already a LOT of CC, especially if you nom a diving champ, but doing 36%+ of their health ON TOP OF THAT? It's like WTF

It's pretty much Skarner's ult on steroids.
Except he'll end up being a melee champion without survivability, mobility, or any form of instant on demand CC.

Just a skarner ult, kalista ult, old deathfire grasp in one on his W. Also a TF ult with an ally. And 44% damage reduction OR double your HP(kinda) on a short cooldown.

He's strong to make up for the lack of mobility. ....also his E makes him incredibly tanky no matter what he builds. And his damage scales with bonus health, so....

He's already melee, has a metric ton of survivability with his E, his R makes him quite mobile, his current CC is a 2s ungodly damaging ability from hell. He's got the utility already, he doesn't need his W doing 36% plus 4% per 100 AP on top of 2s of CC.

3s at rank 5. \o/

And a reposition, with 1.4 second stun on his Q or something like that. He has delayed kinda quirky CC, yeah. But he has to hit an enemy three times to do that, which is... difficult.

Quirky, sure, but his reward shouldn't be a ton of damage. All stuns that require multiple hits don't do 36% health. That's just insaaaaaaane. They nerfed Evelynn for having that, like, they nerfed her to the floooooooooooooor for having it. lol. While his own is melee, he doesn't have that much of an issue getting it off since you can AA+Q+AA+W the enemy rather quickly if need be to get off a huge amount of damage as well as CC.

Don't get me started on what his solo lane is like after a few points into his W. You just nom them when they get near, drag them into your minions, spit them out at half health, now the person is taking minion aggro and being hit by your AA's and Q's. Most have issues getting passed that grey health too. People thought pre-rework Karma shield turning a healthbar grey was strong, this guy's shield takes it to a whole new level. lol.

They nerfed Evelynn for doing that to an entire team, from range, while having permanent invisibility so you couldn't react to it.

Meanwhile that's on someone who has the mobility of a sack of flour, with the only reliable CC to get close to someone enough for 2-3 autoattacks being a 20-60% single target slow.

> It's pretty much Skarner's ult on steroids.

You'll probably be happy to hear that it's already been nerfed to 32% at max rank, then.
Also, it's not true damage.  Actual damage will be less than the tooltip, even if you're building void staff (which you probably won't).

I am happy. It was nerfed to 32% and its ratio was also reduced to 2% per 100. While it doesn't do true damage, with just a RoA and a Liandry's or Rylai's, you'd have about 200 AP, so it would've done 44% of a tanks health. Say they have 150 MR. That's 150/250 (Formula is MR/MR+100), which is 60% reduction, on a tank. So that's 40% of the 44%, which is still about 18% of their max health, which for a single shot can be a lot.

Most won't do this to a tank with 150 MR though, they'll usually hit that diving carry, Bruiser, or APC. If it's a carry, they usually have 27 MR from runes at max level and a base of about 50-60, so we'll go with 60 to make it easy. That's 87 total MR. Say you're going PURE tank after the 200 AP, not even getting any MPen in runes or items or anything. So that's 87/187, which is about 46% reduction. So you're doing around half of your W says it'll do. That's still about 22%+ of their health while they're being CC'd for 3 seconds, which isn't QSS'able or cleansable.

Yeeaah, it was scary before. At least now it'll max around 16-18%ish on carries, and closer to 12%ish on tanks, making it a lot less threatening, but still incredibly scary since it's 3 seconds of CC. Bard's ult is about 2.5s and this is pretty much the equivalent of that since you can't hit the enemy you nom. 

He should be a bit better now, especially if they fix his damn W bug. I believe the last patch fixed it. Could eat an ally cross-map.

From what I've seen of PBE streams he looks a bit over the top. Not having dashes is not enough compensation for having just about everything else. He has insane damage while building full tank, is one of the best tanks in the game with that insane shield, and obviously has game changing utility on multiple spells.

You can't really remove his utility without totally reworking his kit -- besides, that utility is what makes him unique so that is the last thing that should go. 

Therefor, I foresee either his shield being nerfed so he isn't ridiculously tanky, or the bonus damage from HP being lowered so he can't dish out so much without building any damage.
